page.title: 15FARMING
page.content:
Over half of our area is rural but this does not include any large farms. The farms in our area are small hill_farms. These are predominantly sheep farms that utilise the rough grazing of the mountainside. The only crops grown are hay for winter feeding and one small area of kale for animal feed.
The other main farming activity is that of forestry (tree farming). This is done by the Forestry Commission. The trees are predominantly Norway or Sitka Spruce. They are usually harvested after a period of thirty years. The timber is used for pit props, fencing and furniture.
Many of the hill_farms have now become derelict and much of the mountainside is now being afforested.
